metadata.title: CVE-2015-4509 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the HTMLVideoElement interface in MozillaFirefox before 41.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.3 allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted JavaScript code thatmodifies the URI table of a media element, aka ZDI-CAN-3176.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4509` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
